column4: hi all! I want to chmod my files at webserver (user www-data). I want to rw-rw---- access rights. When i doing 'chmod -R 660 path' after that I see (ls -al) ?????????? ? ? ? ?                ? index.php
filesystem or hardidsk problem ? drive mounted via sshfs ?
with HDD - no problems, and I don't know how to check sshfs at this hdd or not.
your problems sounds like it is a mounted sshfs volume, but are you saying it's just one computer with a hard disk ? no network connections ?
maybe reboot and use 'recovery mode' and then try e2fsck /dev/hda1 (or /dev/whatever your partitions are).
when i do" chmod -R 777 - it looks okay...
VERY weird. i had a client with a RAM problem and that f*** up reiserfs badly.
try reboot and run memtest (press ESC when Grub is loading !)
hmm did you reboot in recovery mode ?
or just unmont /dev/sda3 ? Dont do fsck on a mounted drive !
